snippet: According to a report from the New York City comptroller’s office, windows across the city’s public housing complexes have fallen into a degree of disrepair that seems drawn from generations past.
abstract: New York City comptroller’s office reports that windows across the city’s public housing complexes have fallen into a degree of disrepair; from 2005 to 2011, after a period of modest gains, the number of broken or missing windows in New York City Housing Authority buildings has increased 945 percent.
lead_paragraph: According to a report from the New York City comptroller’s office, windows across the city’s public housing complexes have fallen into a degree of disrepair that seems drawn from generations past.

headline.main: Broken Windows (Real Ones) Surge in Public Housing
headline.print_headline: Broken Windows (Real Ones) Surge in Public Housing
